page.title: 19MONNINGTON COURT AND CHURCH
page.content: MONNINGTON COURT AND CHURCH The court and church stand in a lovely position on the banks of the Wye, near the ancient Walk, one of the oldest tree lined avenues in the country. The small church, rebuilt by Uvedale Tomkyns in 1679 and regularly used for services, is still lit only by oil lamps. The Court dating from the 13th century is the home of film maker John Bulmer and his wife Angela Connner the Sculptor whose works can be seen in a sculpture garden specially created for them. Also at the Court is the Foundation Farm of the Morgan Horse of GB. The work of training and breeding can be seen by visitors and there are special displays of the Morgans at various times of the year.
